abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Engineering Project will
            assist the Government in implementing measures to improve
            the conditions of electricity distribution in the country by
            providing the beneficiaries with modern equipment and
            methodologies to improve their distribution, planning, and
            design capability.  Specifically, the project consists of
            four distribution studies.  These studies aim to (i) improve
            the sector organization and coordination for distribution of
            electricity, (ii) evaluate the quality and reliability of
            electricity service and the origin and level of losses,
            (iii) design and implement methodologies for least-cost
            planning and define standards for materials and equipment;
            and (iv) recommend procedures for improving the
            utilities' operational planning, budgeting and
            inventory control.  In addition, the project includes (b) a
            metering program designed to provide data for studies under
            (a) above and to improve system expansion planning, rate
            design and billing; and, finally, (c) a training program
            which will include fellowships, courses and arrangements
            with foreign distribution companies for on-the-job training.
            The project will provide the Government with recommendations
            for increasing the efficiency of the utilities in charge of
            distribution services.
